library.description: Framework-agnostic, micro-library for getting stack traces in all web browsers
library.name: stacktrace.js

library.description:
Gives information about the current session.

To use: include the file session.js, then access the visitor object. It uses the google javascript loader to get location data. For async loading, use the window.session_loaded callback.
library.name: Session.js

library.description:
NDoc is an inline comment parser and JavaScript documentation generator written in Node.JS. This project was inspired by PDoc. It tries to keep compatibility, but has some differences:

NDoc is primarily a CLI tool, so you don't need to code your documentor, although it can be easily used as library.
Clarified EBNF syntax. Definitions now MUST be separated with an empty line from the following comments.
Added options for deprecated tag: you can set versions, when tag was deprecated and when method/property will be removed.
Added new tags: read-only, internal, chainable
Events support.
library.name: NDoc

library.description:
BetterExamples.js is a tool to make live Javascript examples a pleasant experience.
Works in Chrome, Firefox, Opera and IE9.
Even includes a Step-debug mode for stepping through your code.
library.name: BetterExamples.js

library.description: Log Javascript errors and events in the cloud.
library.name: JSLogger

library.description: The most popular and powerful web development tool
library.name: Firebug

library.description:
Detect if DevTools is open.

Useful for when you want something special to happen when DevTools is open. Like pausing canvas, adding style debug info, etc.
library.name: devtools-detect

library.description:
Capo is a module that serves for managing event-driven js architectures and encourages mediator pattern usage solving its biggest weakness - uncertainty of event triggers and listeners.
It creates report containing triggers and subscriptions of events.
library.name: capo

library.description: A browser extension that takes JavaScript frameworks and makes their internals visible, including views, models, class names, and more.
library.name: Illuminations for Developers

library.description: Console tracer for Web SQL or SQLite
library.name: webSqlTracer

library.description: A console mouse-driven REPL for node.js
library.name: janeway
